subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] A solution to no radio stations
author: Rj
full_text:
--0-624688474-1236524749=:48909
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=utf-8
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

Thats intriguing Frank.=C2=A0 This sets up several other interesting opport=
unities:

1) Since the input source can be repeated, you can develop repeat=
able tests.=C2=A0 So if you have a 30 minute tape, you can arrange to ask a=
 set group of questions.=C2=A0 You can then repeat this test multiple times=
.=C2=A0 Theoretically, if the selections coming through are being influence=
d by the same entity, the results should be statistically similar over seve=
ral runs.=C2=A0 If there is no statistical similarity, that would suggest t=
he selections are random, and not being influenced by any entities.=C2=A0 T=
his would be a great addition to the test space for these technologies,

2)=
 Using this method, perhaps more testing and experiments can now be done in=
side a controlled environment,=C2=A0 like a Faraday cage.=C2=A0 This would =
allow the creation of controlled, repeatable tests, without going out into =
the sticks.

3) On the downside, this also sets up a potential for abuse, w=
herein a person could seed a tape with the names of people, dates, and othe=
r words thought to be relevant to a given the location of an evp session.=
=C2=A0 The more often these words occur on the tape, even using random sele=
ction, the more likely they will be played in response to questions.=C2=A0 =
Even a person who does not intend for this to happen, could still create so=
me stastical issues unless the tape is very carefully controlled to be rand=
om.

In fact, if you find that this tape approach seems to have utility, th=
e whole idea of selection from radio broadcasts could be replaced by using =
several standardized tapes, and a new focus of the evp community would be o=
n this standardization.

Rj

=C2=A0cause the most =E2=80=9Cexciting=E2=80=
=9D ones to be selected and played during the EVP session.

--- On Sat, 3/7=
/09, Frank Sumption <purplealiengirl@...> wrote:

From: Frank Sumption=
 <purplealiengirl@...>
Subject: [EVP-ITC] A solution to no radio stati=
ons
To: "group" <evp-itc@yahoogroups.com>
Date: Saturday, March 7, 2009, 8:=
24 PM











    
            


=C2=A0I recently ran into the problem =
here in Colorado where I got kinda roped into ghost hunting. No radio stati=
ons so the box function was poor.=C2=A0 So when=C2=A0I got back home this a=
fternoon and added an "aux input" jack, and raw source switch to the box. N=
ow I can use a pre-recorded raw tape in locations where there's no radio st=
ations to use as the raw audio. "Theoretically" , each use of the raw tape =
should produce different EVP voices the same as using the same raw audio fi=
le in different sessions of EVPmaker. 

=C2=A0

=C2=A0There's a new device =
I just saw used yesterday, a "geophone". It's used like the K-2 metter, but=
 seems much more sensitive, and consistent. B.G. Micro supposedly has kits.=
 You can't hand hold the geophone, as it's extrememly sesnitive to vibratio=
n, so it sits on a stable surface, and yes-no questions are asked of the sp=
irits--after a brief expalnantion of how to manipulate it--same as the K-2.=
 

=C2=A0

=C2=A0Frank-S

Windows Live=E2=84=A2 Groups: Create an online sp=
ot for your favorite groups to meet. Check it out.

 

      

    
    
	
=
